column4: hey i only have a 366mhz processor. What can i do to speed up linux?
use a lightweight window manager (or just use console)
I installed debian on one of them, with X and openbox, and it ran well - I like the kernel hack for using the 'sleep' light as an hd access indicator
my hd is so loud i dont need a light, lol.
the *boxes are nice, I use openbox here
not at all - it's easy to configure with keybindings for everything
no hideous icons disfiguring the noble austerity of your root window
or run gkrellm in the slit - that has a wifi plugin
